document.heading: District of Columbia Family Support Act Federal Conformity Amendment Temporary Act of 1990

history.narrative: Law 8-144, the “District of Columbia Family Support Act Federal Conformity Amendment Temporary Act of 1990,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-543. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 27, 1990, and April 10, 1990, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 26, 1990, it was assigned Act No. 8-200 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
